greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime factors (with multiplicity) of the Stella Octangula numbers A007588.
comment: Because of the polynomial factorization, the Stella Octangula numbers can never be prime. They are semiprime when n = is prime and 2*n^2-1 is also prime. That is, the n-th Stella Octangula number is semiprime for n = 2, 3, 7, 11, 13, 17, 41, 43, 59, 73, 109, 113, 127, 137, 157, 179, 181, 197, 199, ...; that sequence is A106483.
link: J. V. Post, Table of Polytope Numbers, Sorted, Through 1,000,000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Stella Octangula Number.
example: 73*(2*73^2 - 1) = 777961 = 73 * 10657, which has two prime factors, so a(73) = 2.
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, May 03 2005
